channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023090525
item.description:
Report E-2023090525

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN1789 Hydrochloric Acid 31% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contactors for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-ounce of material released to the top of the tote in a 1’ x 1’ area due to a loose/damaged cap. The cap was replaced with a new one and the tote was wiped down with a sodium bicarb solution. The damaged cap, impacted rags, and PPE were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023082042
item.description:
Report X-2023082042

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to the load side due to pkg. leaking and when arrived pkg. was already inside a lined tote leaking out. DescribePack: Closure came completely off and all the liquid leaked out of bottle causing the outer carton to soil. DurationRel: 16 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

item.title: Report X-2023081592
item.description:
Report X-2023081592

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-19
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Marked as fully regulated but shipped under non-hazmat service code. No hazmat shipping papers. Plastic jugs in corrugated carton with styrofoam sheet top pad. Loose cap on one jug allowed leakage which damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023081590
item.description:
Report X-2023081590

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-19
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal cans in Uline doublewall corrugated can shipper carton. Clips used in place of Uline locking rings. Loose plastic wrap filler in space for fourth can. Two cans dented flat on one side, lifting lids and allowing spillage which damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On the August 5,2023, on flight UA1951 IAD-SFO passenger Fuller/Gerald's laptop was getting hot during the flight. The laptop was transferred inside the thermal bag by the flight crew customer indicated it was a re-furbished MacBook Battery appreared to vent and was placed in a Thermal Containment bag
